title: Was the beer Norm drank on Cheers real beer? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was indeed actual beer! However, it was nothing like the kind you'd ever want to drink. It was a beverage called “near beer” and as its name implies, it was nearly beer, from an alcohol standpoint. It was brewed, made from yeast and hops as regular beer is, but it was as watered down as a $8 cup of beer you'd inexplicably buy at Fenway Park. It reportedly was “like drinking beer flavored Gatorade, but with the carbonation of a bottle of seltzer water” according to George Wendt aka “Norm Peterson” The idea was to has a visual depiction of beer that looked like the real thing, without cast members getting sloshed on it.

Drinking real alcoholic beverages is not usually done because during filming it is not unusual for there to be multiple takes of the same scene and if the actors were drinking a real alcoholic drink, they would not be able to “wrap” the filming session. What is usually consumed is carbonated iced tea or near-beer e.g. O’Douls or other brands.
